name: Catalonia Royal Tulum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wife and I have traveled to many all inclusive in Mexico and other countries. CRT gets high marks in most areas.
reviews.title: Royal Treatment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Size
reviews.title: The Perfect Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Smaller than the mega resorts but large enough to offer diversity in dining options. Adults only is a plus also. Beach, pool, lunch buffet and another restaurant at one end with the lobby and other restaurants and a bar at the other. Rooms are in the middle with a very nice path through the jungle connecting it all.
reviews.title: paradise found!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms
reviews.title: Our second trip to Mexico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and comfortable. No ocean views from any room. Six buildings, three facing the other three. Jungle setting so if you like it bright get an upper floor. Buildings 1, 3 and 5 get the afternoon sun and the others get the morning sun.
reviews.title: Honeymoon 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My stay at this resort was from April 2nd to April 16th, 2013. After being told by my travelling agent how this resort was unique and beautifull with the most beautifull beach of Mexico....
reviews.title: Deception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived from the Cancun airport in a little 13 passengers bus overcrowded to the hôtel around 14:00hres. Of course the room was not ready and a long wait of 1:30 hres was necessary.
reviews.title: Great smaller resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The policy of this hôtel is scandalous....First they let you know that the room you have reserved hasn't been renovated and that there are other beautifull rooms available and renovated for 25,35,55 dollars more a day!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We refused the upgrade and found ourself in a room ( fairly clean and decent ) except for the air conditionning system that had not been cleaned for the past 10 years. The musty smell exhausting from the air conditionning impregnated all our belongings wich forced us upon return to decontaminate all our things.
reviews.title: What a great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was decent but nothing fancy and of less quality then 3 years ago, according to frequent travellers met there.
reviews.title: Great jungle setting and fabulous beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed at the Catalonia Royal Tulum from May 24-28 and I can't say enough of how well our stay was at the hotel. Having stayed at two other all inclusives this one was probably the best of the three. With one of the two being Barcelo Maya Beach, I thought CRT blew Barcelo out of the water.
reviews.title: Write it down, CRT scores again !

likes.disliked: — Long walk from room to beach/lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Arrival:
reviews.title: Wonderful vaction -- again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving at the airport we encountered no problems. About 20 minutes trying to get through customs but after that no to much to it. We actually chose to go a different route and use Cancun Valet for a private airport transers (about $145 round trip for 7 people) and it was great not having to stop and drop off other travelers. Front desk was ok. Greeted wish mimosas and checked in fine. We arrived at about noon and rooms weren't ready till 3 so we just dropped off our bags and went to scope out the grounds. For most part the front desk was hit or miss.
reviews.title: Great Escape

likes.disliked: — the housekeeping was inconsistent in cleaning our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms/Building:
reviews.title: Relaxing vacation,great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very good. Plenty big and definately clean. Yes the beds were hard but that didn't stop us from sleeping so no big deal. Fridge was always stocked with Dos X, Coke, Sprite, water and some small snacks. Cleaning crew did a great job of always leaving enough towels and cleaning up really well. View from balcony was not to impressive. Some trees and a little bit of the building next door. But then again I didn't spend to much time hanging out there. AC worked great. I will say the walk from the rooms to the lobby and pool/beach can be fairly distant. I don't see if it would be a problem with someone who is accustomed to walking but as others have said for someone disabled or elderly it could be a problem. Other than the the walkways were pretty cool surrounded with jungle vegetation,iguanas, and other creatures. Also was well lit at night.
reviews.title: Add another great review!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at this resort for four nights.This is a not a large resort,and I like that.The gounds were long and narrow,with one nicely landscaped path runnig from the lobby to the beach through the lush foliage.The beach was very nice.Soft sand and shallow water.The pool was large and uncrowded.The food was better than average with a couple of choices of where to eat.We liked the Mexican restaurant.The staff were friendly.Our rooms were the only disappointment .Not clean and with a funky smell that did not go away even with the doors open.The bed was very stiff.We could hear every sound the neighbors made.I dont know if all the rooms are like this.Overall a nice resort if you spend your time away from your room.
reviews.title: Great beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at CRT from April 16-30th, 2008( for two weeks).
reviews.title: Wonderful trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: After a short wait at the airport, we drove directly to the resort in a mini-van with three other couples. We were greeted with champagne and a cool cloth during check-in, which was very smooth. (We arrived around 2pm, and our room was ready. Our bags were brought up within minutes.)
reviews.title: in love with Catalonia Royal Tulum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Front desk: well-staffed, everyone eager to help and competent. We had no issues with the front desk service. Informative and professional.
reviews.title: Paradise

likes.disliked: — On check out day room was only avaiable to us until noon, or 5pm for an additional charge. Our flight left at 2:30am. That left us without a room for 11 hours before we left to go to the airport.

reviews.title: Beautiful Area!!
reviews.text: Lobby area: circular area centred with a huge waterfall-themed pond/water feature. Chairs surround the waterfall and the lobby is tastefully decorated with plants, flowers and artwork.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location and hotel facilities were nice however the food choice was very poor. There were 6 restaurants to choose from of an evening but we were disappointed in all of them. Food choice and portions were very small. The buffet restaurant for breakfast was also poor for choice and you had to wait for coffee to be served, as a result i sometimes found i'd finished my food before this occurred. No means of serving yourself hot drinks! Considering this was Mexico there was a distinct lack of spicy food even in the Mexican restaurant. I think my vision of Mexican food is Tex Mex! I dont want to go on too much about the food so will review other hotel aspects.
reviews.title: Disappointing food made what could have been a fab review just average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Rooms come as either 2 double beds or one superkingsize bed. We ended up with both due to a room change mid holiday and preferred the superking as we have one of these at home.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives : Food (sorry) Small complex so difficult to avoid loud entertainment at night. There are only 6 hotel blocks. Blocks 5 and 6 are the quietest as nearer the beech but the hotel wanted extra money if you requested a top floor room in 5 or 6! Top floor rooms are the only rooms that look out over the complex, all the other floors (ground and 1st) look out into a jungle. Pretty but mosquito heaven. Also the hotel has speakers in the forest playing classical music, a nice touch just not at 11pm if you fancy an early night and you've got one outside your room! Rowdy Americans acting like they were on an 18-30 holiday! We requested a room move because of this.
reviews.title: Why we return to CRT...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives: Nice location, lovely beech and sea was lovely to swim in. You found yourself swimming with fish. Angel fish i think. Forest through centre of hotel a bit like the set of an Indiana Jones film location complete with Iguanas and Coyotes. (Be warned ladies the pathway through centre of hotel grounds can be tricky in high heels!) Fridge and coffee machine in rooms.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we had an ok time. We're quite well travelled and have also been on a few cruises so our expectations have risen over the years, hence disapointment with food on offer !!!
reviews.title: The Honeymoon of dreams

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at CRT from April 12-15 before moving on to Akumal Beach Resort -Also a beautiful place. We arrived at CRT at 10:30 PM to a warm welcome and a cold drink and moist towel. We were told our room would be in the first build near the lobby (We really hoped for a room near the pool) we went to our room to find the room had been locked (latched) on the inside. We used the phone in the building lobby to call the front desk. They quickly sent maintance. and another fellow showed up as well, he asked if we would like to change rooms if they couldnt get it open. We said yes preferrably something close to the pool. He did get it open but we still wanted to change rooms. He said there wasnt anything in the build near the pool but he could get us in the middle building. PERFECT! it was half way from everything. AWESOME ROOM. It was so nice . the rooms are comfortable ( hard beds But not as hard as some....ABR. But we slept well everynight. the shower is wonderful. Graet water pressure and enough warm water to go around. The beach!!!!! OMG it is great. All the other hotels on this beach are closed. except 1 a boutique style far enough way the you don't even notice them from your beach. I loved jogging the beach each morning and jumping in the water afterwards. It was so nice. The food at the buffet was good plenty to choose from, Lunch was the same. We didnt get to the ala cartes. didnt need to for 3 nights. The pool entertainment was fun. Not to pushy if you didn't want to participate. Chairs around the pool fill up fast. by 8 am. But plenty at the beach. GO and enjoy you will love this place IF you don't mind a BIT of a walk. Someone who is in average shape or good health would have NO problems. Its paradise!
reviews.title: Beautiful place on earth!

likes.liked: — The Room and the Beach were great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our stay at the Catalonia Royal Tulum. Overall our stay was very relaxing and enjoyable. My husband and I used to stay in Playa del Carmen. However, we have found that lately it feels more like an over-commercialized version of Miami; where people try to rip you off at every turn. It is very sad. Playa used to be such a wonderful place - but that is another issue.
reviews.title: Good hotel - great beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That is the background story for how we decided to go to an all-inclusive resort on this trip. We enjoyed our visit to the Catalonia Royal Tulum. It is a very well kept hotel. The grounds are clean and manicured. Our room was extremely clean. The layout of the resort is very well designed. The resort is small, but does require minimal walking. My husband and I could not understand all of the complaints people have written about the amount of walking that they did at this resort. If you are not physically disabled and are under 70, the walking should not bother you. The resort is not handi-capped friendly though. There are no elevators, and the paths are made out of un-even stone - so it would be nearly impossible to navigate in a wheel chair.
reviews.title: Awesome Beach!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our main dissapointment with the resort was the quality of the food at the a la carte restaurants. We went to the Italian restaurant twice and the grill once. The grill restaurant was terrible. We shared a steak at the grill that would have been better suited to a life as a tire - it was so rubbery. There is nothing like chewing your piece of meat over and over and over; I seriously think that I injured my jaw at this restaurant. The Italian restaurant was better - but still not good. The service at these restaurants was less than stellar. We never even had desert at these dinners due to incredibly slow service. The food at these restaurants seems to be prepared ahead of time and refrigerated for long periods. It did not taste fresh at all. It was very strange. The drink selections were very limited, the wine was horrible. I wish I could say something better about them. Actually, the view was excellent, as they were located next to the beach.
reviews.title: Overall Great Experience at Catalonia Royal Tulum

likes.disliked: — the reception workers were not willing to give needed assistance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the food at the buffets to be much better than the food at the a la carte restaurants. The buffets were very good. We especially like breakfast. There were great fresh juices, an omelette bar, just everything anybody could want for breakfast! It was great!
reviews.title: Nice for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: The Royal Catalonia Tulum is this hotel's name, but it isn't in Tulum. The former Copacabana, it is located on the lovely beach of Xpu-Ha. Its 288 rooms are in buildings set back from the beach, with a stone-paved walkway to the beach and pool in one direction and the lobby and dining room in the other. This area has nice garden plantings and a little river. The rooms are well laid out and quite comfortable.
reviews.title: All-inclusive on the beach

likes.disliked: — The very loud pool scene, crowded beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The pool complex is large and very popular, with activities scheduled. The water at the beach is shallow a long way out, which is good for children but there are some rocks. Adult swimmers may want to venture out past the 'swimming area' protected by floats.
reviews.title: Best Time Ever!

likes.disliked: — Our room not being ready or what we requested

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The main dining room offers mediocre buffet meals; both the free wine choices, white and red, are poor. Most of the adults at dinner are drinking beer, and I can see why.
reviews.title: How can you complain?

likes.disliked: — The hard beds and the nightly entertainment

reviews.title: Beautiful Beach
reviews.text: Be careful to return your beach towel card when you check out, or $30 will be added to your bill!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Catalonia Royal Tulum on April 8, 2008 and stayed one week. We had a little trouble when we first arrived because our rooms where not ready, we were told to come back at 3p.m. When it was determined that they wouldn't be ready until 4 or 5 p.m. and we were not happy (very hot, and very tired), they graciously assigned us different rooms. My husband and I were upgraded to a suite and the couple with us were given a regular room down the hall (instead of being side by side as we had requested). This turned out to be a very small thing, as the rest of our vacation was wonderful!!
reviews.title: Perfect beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first time to an all inclusive in Mexico and we were not disappointed in the overall experience. We arrived April 18th and the weather was amazing! Thank you Mexico.
reviews.title: First time to CRT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived with another couple (their first time for a southern vacation) and were received at the front desk with a cloth to wash off the grime, and a lovely drink. Of course our rooms were not ready so we did have to change in the washroom...which was immaculate as were all the washrooms during our week stay. We both had booked Junior Suites...which I would not recommend. Save your money.
reviews.title: Visited CRT for the 6th time in February!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The problem was with one of the ladies at the reception desk...she was rather pushy and rude. The other lady was extremely friendly and kind...and I felt as if she may have had less seniority because she let the other one take over rather abruptly. Not a pleasant experience for all of us. She wanted to put us both in Block 1 or 2 and we specifically asked for a room closer to the beach, at least 4 months prior to our trip. We stood my ground and we were put in block 4.
reviews.title: Beautiful Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were celebrating our 30th anniversary...and by the way, there was no acknowlegment from anyone at the resort. I know they were aware because we saw the note written on our card upon arrival. Not very impressed with that as well.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone else we met during our entire trip were amazing. I mean everyone. The resort was spotless, the food was great, the beach was spotless, the staff could not do enough for you and were always smiling. Great overall experience. Loved the Mexican, Tapas and Asian restaurants.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

description: Adults only all-inclusive resort, located in Xpu-Ha, Riviera Maya, on the Caribbean coastline. It is surrounded by native jungle trees, local plants, mangroves and cenotes - water springs where a diverse variety of flora and fauna can be found in an unspoiled habitat. It is just 25km from Playa del Carmen and Tulum's archaeological site, and 85 km south of Cancun International airport, in Quintana Roo State, Mexico.
